project.teaser: IDERHA will address the key obstacles to achieving appropriate access, sharing, use and reuse of lung cancer data, and thus enable enhanced regulatory and HTA decision-making recommendations for integrated health research, with the aim to improve care and better meet the needs...
project.objective: IDERHA will address the key obstacles to achieving appropriate access, sharing, use and reuse of lung cancer data, and thus enable enhanced regulatory and HTA decision-making recommendations for integrated health research, with the aim to improve care and better meet the needs of patients and health care professionals. The IDERHA open platform for multi-modal health data will enhance innovation in EU health care systems and is directly scalable by means of connecting additional systems, data sources and additional services and tools. It will extend and elaborate standards in semantic interpretation, data quality, ethics and transferability to ensure the harmonisation of heterogeneous data sources and wider health data reuse. Use cases positioned along the lung cancer patient pathway will be implemented using retrospective data and in a remote patient care context. These practical implementations will demonstrate the added value of multi-modal data aggregation and analysis with impacts expected on public health, patient burden, health outcomes and cost. We will perform AI/ML based lung-cancer risk profiling using patient`s EHRs, and improved CT image- based AI/ML to provide risk prediction of potential lung cancer patients, and explore the possibilility of personal prognosis of disease progression. Using patient monitoring and engagement, including digital biomarker, PROMs, and connected devices, the IDERHA platform will enable remote patient monitoring, and provide data for joint patient-health professional decision making. Along with health care stakeholders, IDERHA will develop consensus policy recommendations for appropriate data sharing to enable multi-stakeholder research. Informed by Patient Advisory Groups, we will address critical obstacles and issues to heterogeneous health data primary and secondary use. Regulatory and HTA agencies will be engaged to create criteria for assessing the acceptability of heterogeneous health research results in regulatory and HTA decision-making.
project.title: Integration of heterogeneous Data and Evidence towards Regulatory and HTA Acceptance
project.keywords: Lung cancer, regulatory decision making, data integration and application, continuum of care, patient engagement, RWE, AI, ML, EHDS, wearables, clinical decision support, EU policies, FAIR

article.title: Enhanced health data integration improving remote care health technology assessment

result.title: Reality Check: The Aspirations of the European Health Data Space Amidst Challenges in Decentralized Data Analysis (Preprint)

details.authors: Holger Fröhlich, Anne Funck Hansen, Mika Hilvo, Gunther Jansen, Sumit Madan, Sobhan Moazemi, Sanziana Negreanu, Venkata Satagopam, Phil Gribbon, Christian Muehlendyck

result.title: Getting ready for the European Health Data Space (EHDS): IDERHA's plan to align with the latest EHDS requirements for the secondary use of health data

details.authors: Hussein, Rada; Balaur, Irina; Burmann, Anja; Ćwiek-Kupczyńska, Hanna; Gadiya, Yojana; Ghosh, Soumyabrata; Jayathissa, Prabath; Katsch, Florian; Kremer, Andreas; Lähteenmäki, Jaakko; Meng, Zhaoling; Morasek, Kathrin; C. Rancourt, Rebecca; Satagopam, Venkata; Sauermann, Stefan; Scheider, Simon; Stamm, Tanja; Muehlendyck, Christian; Gribbon, Philip

result.title: Data Management Plan (1)
result.description: The Data Management Plan (DMP) will be a living document and evolve during the lifetime of the project in order to describe the data management life cycle for the data that is currently available (retrospective data) and the data to be collected (prospective data), processed and/or generated by IDERHA project and how to provide FAIRfication for research data. It will also cover data flows within consortia, GDPR, data privacy and security and long-term sustainability.

result.title: Consensus policy recommendations for data sharing, access and use governance policies
result.description: A report detailing consensus policy recommendations to create clarity on responsible data governance to enable more streamlined multi-stakeholder partnerships for health research. The recommendations will include approaches to address patient privacy, legal, ethical, regulatory and institutional concerns for accessing, sharing and using heterogeneous health data

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - IDERHA (Integration of heterogeneous Data and Evidence towards Regulatory and HTA Acceptance)
result.teaser: In recent years, there has been a significant increase in the generation of health data from various sources such as digital technologies, patient-reported outcome measures, clinical trials, and routine clinical care. This data holds great potential for advancing both research...

webItem.alternativeText: IDERHA group photo taken at the Annual Consortium Meeting in April 2024 in Berlin
Representation on how IDERHA aligns with the European Health Data Space (EHDS)

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Data and analysis platform architecture (incl. different data sources and data types support) (1)
result.description: Report on the architecture principles, blueprint, governance, standardization, and interfaces that will guide the implementation, adoption, and integration. Describes the architecture for the different platforms and their interconnection in area of care and research

result.title: Report on Global Regulatory Best Practices Analysis
result.description: Inventory and analysis of current assessment approaches and policies of evidence generated from heterogeneous health data to identify 1) potential best practices for broader adoption, and 2) current gaps in policies for criteria for regulatory, HTA and payer acceptance of evidence generated using heterogeneous health care data.

result.title: BMC Medical Informatics and Decision Making

details.authors: Madan, Sumit; Lentzen, Manuel; Brandt, Johannes; Rueckert, Daniel; Hofmann-Apitius, Martin; Fröhlich, Holger
details.journalTitle: BMC Medical Informatics and Decision Making

result.title: Hygiaso Revolutionizes Patient Discovery Through AI-Powered Real-World Health Data
Analysis of current and emerging policies for data access/sharing, research use and transparency requirements
result.description: Inventory and comparative analysis of policy and legislative enablers, disablers and gaps impacting on the scale up of health data access for evidence generation. This will consider EU level instruments, selected national and health care center examples, and consider impacts from the perspective of different data stakeholders.

result.title: Description of Communication and dissemination tools
result.description: Website, newsletters, social media channels, video, animation, infographic, webinars, press releases, visual identity, template for Word and PowerPoint, style guide etc.

category.title: machine learning
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/computer and information sciences/artificial intelligence/machine learning

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

category.title: HORIZON JU Research and Innovation Actions
